name: Iceberg Lounge
description: A notorious nightclub owned by Oswald Cobblepot, also known as The Penguin, serving as a hub for Gotham's underworld activities.

content.title: History
content.body: The Iceberg Lounge was established by Oswald Cobblepot, better known as The Penguin. It quickly became a famous nightspot for both Gotham's elite and criminal elements. Over the years, it has served as Penguin's base of operations, providing him a legitimate front for his various illegal activities.

content.title: Geography
content.body: Located in the heart of Gotham City, the Iceberg Lounge occupies a prominent space that is easily accessible to both the city's affluent socialites and its criminal underground. Its high-rise structure stands out with its distinct icy decor and iceberg-shaped bar.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body: The lounge is renowned for its extravagant and theatrical interiors, featuring icy decorations, a massive aquarium showcasing a variety of exotic marine life, and private VIP areas for discreet meetings. The centerpiece is the large iceberg-shaped bar, known for serving premium drinks.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: In 'The Batman (2022)', the Iceberg Lounge serves as a pivotal setting where multiple key interactions occur. It becomes a focal point of Batman's investigation into the criminal activities plaguing Gotham, leading to confrontations that drive the narrative forward.
